newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT- Chrysler '97 EPS cut.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT- Chrysler '97 EPS cut.

text.p: --Furman Selz analyst Maryann Keller said she cut her 1997 full-year estimate to $4.07 from $4.53 because of rising incentives and reduced production. Chrysler, which earned $4.73 in 1996, is still rated a hold.

--Keller said the automaker's June sales are expected to be down 20 percent from a year ago. Future margin gains will be due more to cost-cutting than price increases or market share improvements. She said Chrysler is reviewing its expenses and plans to cut $1 billion from its capital spending plans over the next few years. That is not expected to change or delay product programs, Keller said.
